intro: Pectocarya peninsularis, commonly known as the Peninsular pectocarya, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the Baja California Peninsula. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and high sunlight exposure. Its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements make it a vulnerable species, highlighting the importance of conservation efforts in its native range.
